BasicValidator

A class for basic data type validators.

Module Contents

class type_forge.validators.basic.BasicValidator[source]

Bases: type_forge.core.base.BaseValidator

A class for basic data type validators.

static safe_bool_convert(value)[source]

Safely convert a value to bool with semantic interpretation.

Parameters:

value (object) – Any value that might be convertible to bool

Returns:

A bool representation of the value, with common string patterns like “yes”/”no” properly handled

Return type:

bool

static safe_float_convert(value)[source]

Safely convert a value to float or return None if invalid.

Parameters:

value (object) – Any value that might be convertible to float

Returns:

A float value or None if conversion is not possible

Return type:

Optional[float]

Returns:

Base validation method for the BasicValidator.

Parameters:

value (object) – The value to validate

Returns:

True if validation succeeds, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

static validate_boolean(value)[source]

Validate that the value is a boolean.

Returns:

The validated boolean

Raises:

ValueError – If the value is not a boolean

Return type:

bool

static validate_dict(value, key_type, value_type)[source]

Validate that the value is a dictionary with specific key and value types.

Parameters:

  • value (object) – The value to validate

  • key_type (Type[T]) – The expected type of keys in the dictionary

  • value_type (Type[S]) – The expected type of values in the dictionary

Returns:

The validated dictionary

Raises:

ValueError – If the value is not a dictionary or contains keys/values of the wrong type

Return type:

Dict[T, S]

static validate_list(value, item_type)[source]

Validate that the value is a list of a specific item type.

Parameters:

  • value (object) – The value to validate

  • item_type (Type[T]) – The expected type of items in the list

Returns:

The validated list

Raises:

ValueError – If the value is not a list or contains items of the wrong type

Return type:

List[T]
